issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task text) specifies Milkable.messageOnMilk() as returning a boolean (UML: messageOnMilk():boolean; Part 2: "The method messageOnMilk() should return true if milking was successful, false otherwise"), whereas the solution repository defines Milkable.messageOnMilk() returning a String and the Seal/Goat implementations return String messages (e.g. "Goat [name] is milked"). This is a structural contract mismatch for the Milkable interface: students following the problem statement will implement a boolean-returning method, but the provided solution (and likely any tests derived from it) use a String-returning method. This discrepancy will confuse students and break compatibility between student implementations, the solution, and automated tests.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the Milkable contract consistent across artifacts. Either:

1) Align solution and template with the problem statement: change Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return boolean, and update Goat and Seal to implement messageOnMilk() with a boolean result (e.g. return true when milking succeeds). Update any code/tests that expect a String message accordingly (for example, if you need a text message, add a separate method or have tests print a confirmation message instead).

OR

2) Align the problem statement with the solution: update the UML and task text to specify that messageOnMilk() returns a String (and describe the expected String content, e.g. "[AnimalType] [name] is milked").

Choose one approach and apply it consistently in the template, problem description, and reference solution so students have an unambiguous method signature to implement.
